edu.umd.cs.psl.model

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umd.cs.psl.model.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    A probabilistic soft logic model.

    Encapsulates a set of Kernels. A ModelApplication can be used to combine a Model with data to perform inference or learn.

    Objects which use a Model should register with it to listen for ModelEvents.

        public void unregisterModelObserver(ModelEvent.Listener observer)

        Parameters:
        observer - object to stop notifying

      • getKernels

        public java.lang.Iterable<Kernel> getKernels()
        Returns:
        the Kernels contained in this model

      • addKernel

        public void addKernel(Kernel k)
        Adds a Kernel to this Model.

        All observers of this Model will receive a ModelEvent#KernelAdded event.

        Parameters:
        k - Kernel to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Kernel is already in this Model

      • removeKernel

        public void removeKernel(Kernel k)
        Removes a Kernel from this Model.

        All observers of this Model will receive a ModelEvent#KernelRemoved event.

        Parameters:
        k - Kernel to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Kernel is not in this Model

      • notifyKernelParametersModified

        public void notifyKernelParametersModified(Kernel k)
        Notifies this Model that a Kernel's parameters were modified.

        All observers of this model will receive a ModelEvent#KernelParametersModified event.

        Parameters:
        k - the Kernel that was modified
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Kernel is not in this Model

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this Model.

        The String will start with "Model:", followed by a newline, then the String representations of each Kernel in this Model (each followed by a newline). Constraint Kernels will come before compatibility kernels.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String representation
        See Also:
        Kernel#isCompatibilityKernel()
